metadata.title: CVE-2022-0635 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Versions affected: BIND 9.18.0 When a vulnerable version of named receives a series of specific queries, the named process will eventually terminate due to a failed assertion check.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-0635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-host - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1
bind9utils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1
dnsutils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1').
